79179071380140032.text: Open - released SDL Guidance and tools, Threat Modelling, Tools: VS Extensions, !exploitable, EMET, Attack Surface Analyzer #AppSecEU

79178504666759169.text: Measuring improvements. DSL - 45% reduction in Vulnerabilities (XP vs Vista) #AppSecEU

79177720508055552.text: Static Analysis: code patterns to enforce policy (ex. make sure the right compile flags are used), identify defects #AppSecEU

79177418228768768.text: Fuzzing. !exploitable Crash Analyzer processes crashdumps. Crash classification: exploitable, probably, not exploitable, unknown #AppSecEU

79176670254338048.text: Mitigations - make a target env unpredictable. "Examples include GS and ASLR" (what are they?) #AppSecEU

79176472836833280.text: Mitigations - harder to turn defect into expllit, reduce the impact of success, put automatic checks in place #AppSecEU

79176264191193088.text: Desired result - usable attacks will be rare and require significant engineering; working exploits - scarce and valuable #AppSecEU

79175992152825856.text: Exploit economics - increase attacker investment required to find vulnerabilities or to write reliable exploits #AppSecEU

79175568679116800.text: products have less bulletins, harder to exploit, updating is more active, criminals attack older versions and 3rd party apps #AppSecEU

79175245809991680.text: Threat situation today - there are still vulnerabilities and security exploits #AppSecEU

79174701997498368.text: Alex is going through the different stages of the life cycle: Reqs, Desing, Implementation, Verfification, Release, Response #AppSecEU

79174219094695936.text: Pre-SDL Requirements: Security training. Set metrics for how many people get trained #AppSecEU

79174028069314561.text: SDL - which apps are required to follow: almost everything #AppSecEU

79173573754884097.text: Trustworthy Computing Security - Response Center and Engineering Center #microsoft #AppSecEU

79173249803632640.text: Security Timeline at Microsoft.  At one point, stopped product shipping until the number of security issues / bugs come down #AppSecEU

79172585690103808.text: Attacks break-down between application, OS and browser vulnerabilities.  Application - most, lately browser attacks trending up #AppSecEU

79172319368585216.text: 2006+ - targeted attacks, social engineering, financial & political #AppSecEU

79171686431334400.text: 2nd keynote at the OWASP Day 2 - Alex Lucas, Microsoft.  Starting with the historical review of cybercrime evolution #AppSecEU

79142957726437376.text: Last question at Tobias' talk - vendors specific HTTP headers. Not discussed since they are not in the queue @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79142459636064257.text: the discussed changes will not give browser warnings - it will be a hard failure (red page) @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79141832751185920.text: Questions start at the Tobias Gondrom's talk.  The new technologies will come with updates rather than new version of the browsers #AppSecEU

79141541431619584.text: Content Security Policy and TLS in DNSSEC - 2012 "Do-Not-Track" up in the air (up to the governments etc) @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79141299344777216.text: When: Mime-Sniffing Q3 '11, Same-Origin - Q4 '11, Strict Transport Security - Q4 '11, Frame-Options - Q4 '11 @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79140984469987328.text: Privacy concerns - do not track HTTP-Request-Header. To be enforced on the server, legal and regulatory pressure @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79140528586887168.text: Content Security Policy is still a draft now - moving target. At least 3 browser vendors say they will implement it @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79139081317130240.text: Contenet Security Policy - report-uri directive to report violations to the given URI @tobiasgondrom. Allows feedback #AppSecEU

79138619616542720.text: Content Security Policy - declare that resources (script, flash, images etc.) may only come from specific locations @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79138120502755328.text: Frame-Options - to prevent framing by evil sites. DENY, SAMEORIGIN , ALLOWFROM (upcoming) @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79137079979802624.text: DNSSEC can be used to declare supported protocols for domains. +: trusted signed source, -: long time to deploy @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79136563879088128.text: mitigate attacks on secure channels - Strict-Transport-Security server header, problem - trust on first use @tobiasgondrom #AppSecEU

79134261160058880.text: Tobias Gondrom's talk on "New Standards and upcoming technologies in browser security" #AppSecEU
